JUnitPerf 1.7 is now available and includes a new TestMethodFactory that
can be used to load test a single test method while ensuring that each
concurrent user thread runs a thread-local instance of the test.

If a test case intended to be decorated as a LoadTest contains
test-specific state in the setUp() method, then a TestFactory should be
used to ensure that each concurrent user thread uses a thread-local
instance of the test.

For example, to create a load test of 10 concurrent users with each user
running a thread-local instance of all the methods of the
ExampleStatefulTest, use:

    int users = 10;
    Test factory = new TestFactory(ExampleStatefulTest.class);
    Test loadTest = new LoadTest(factory, users);

Alternatively, to load test only the "testSomething" method while
ensuring that each user runs a thread-local instance of the test, use:

    int users = 10;
    Test factory = new TestMethodFactory(ExampleStatefulTest.class,
"testSomething");
    Test loadTest = new LoadTest(factory, users);


The JUnitPerf documentation is available at

       http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

JUnitPerf 1.7 can be downloaded directly from

       http://www.clarkware.com/software/junitperf1.7.zip


Any feedback you may have is most welcome and appreciated.

Thanks!

Mike
